title: General
stimulusHtml:
a. 1 point is earned for: Very strict, austere. No Latin citation required.

b. 2 points are earned for:

1 point per item. Reference to the Latin and a translation/paraphrase required for each item. The identification may be contained in the translation. Minimal Latin bolded. Possible answers:

  • ab huius saeculi licentia (from the permissiveness of the current age)

  • a maiorum consuetudine atque concessis (from the practice and allowances of our ancestors)

In the second answer, either maiorum consuetudine or maiorum...concessis is acceptable.
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

a. 1 point is earned for: Very strict, austere. No Latin citation required.

b. 2 points are earned for:

1 point per item. Reference to the Latin and a translation/paraphrase required for each item. The identification may be contained in the translation. Minimal Latin bolded. Possible answers:

  • ab huius saeculi licentia (from the permissiveness of the current age)

  • a maiorum consuetudine atque concessis (from the practice and allowances of our ancestors)

In the second answer, either maiorum consuetudine or maiorum...concessis is acceptable.

In the second answer, either maiorum consuetudine or maiorum...concessis is acceptable.

In the second answer, either maiorum consuetudine or maiorum...concessis is acceptable.
